source.4376af61:
import os
from zipfile import ZipFile

dirName = "./"
zipName = "packages.zip"

# Create a ZipFile Object
with ZipFile(zipName, 'w') as zipObj:
    # Iterate over all the files in directory
    for folderName, subfolders, filenames in os.walk(dirName):
        for filename in filenames:
            if (filename != zipName):
                # create complete filepath of file in directory
                filePath = os.path.join(folderName, filename)
                # Add file to zip
                zipObj.write(filePath)

source.245da3b9:
# pip-downloading packages to your local machine

We will try to download "facenet_pytorch", a package for face detection that is not available in the base kernel provided by Kaggle. Of course this kernel needs internet connection.

See also: [pip-installing packages without internet connection](http://www.kaggle.com/samuelepino/pip-installing-packages-with-no-internet)
